name: 32001 blanc
description: The cream white. Balanced, with stable aesthetics. The first mural ‘Velvet’ shade.

name: 32010 gris foncé 31
description: The iron grey. Soft, warm, expressive. The darkest shade of 1931.

name: 32011 gris 31
description: The medium grey. Elegant and restrained. It can place the walls into shadow.

name: 32012 gris moyen
description: The discreet grey. Natural, neutral, discreetly calm. The second ‘Velvet’ shade.

name: 32013 gris clair 31
description: The pearl grey. Weakly luminescent and airy. The third mural ‘Velvet’ shade.

name: 32020 bleu outremer 31
description: The luminous ultramarin. Dynamic, imposing and much in demand.

name: 32021 outremer moyen
description: The lucent sky blue. Like the sky on a clear, sunny day in summer.

name: 32022 outremer clair
description: The brightened ultramarine. A space atmosphere that loosens up. The first ‘Space’ shade.

name: 32023 outremer pâle
description: The light ultramarine. An atmosphere that recedes gently. The second ‘Space’ shade.

name: 32024 outremer gris
description: The blue grey. The imagination. A restrained atmosphere. The third ‘Space’ shade.

name: 32030 bleu céruléen 31
description: The powerful cerulean. Appears dynamic and attracts the attention.

name: 32031 céruléen vif
description: The luminous cerulean. Warm, sensual, Mediterranean. The colour tends towards the observer.

name: 32032 céruléen moyen
description: The summery sky. Static, does not come forward anymore. The first mural ‘Sky’ shade.

name: 32033 céruléen clair
description: The sky reflected in the water. Subordinates itself. The second mural ‘Sky’ shade.

name: 32034 céruléen pâle
description: The sky reflected in ocean waves. Somewhat greenish. The third mural ‘Sky’ colour shade.

name: 32040 vert anglais
description: The english green. Reminds of aristocracy, also of freshness of the forest.

name: 32041 vert anglais clair
description: The slightly greyed english green. Like a discreet Verona green.

name: 32042 vert anglais pâle
description: The mild grey green. The colour shade links retentively to the landscape.

name: 32050 vert foncé
description: The rich brilliant green. A deep and very neutral green; expressing the summer.

name: 32051 vert 31
description: The vernal green. Very expressive. The first tone of the ‘Scenery’ atmosphere.

name: 32052 vert clair
description: The green of spring. Natural and fruitful. The second shade representing ‘Scenery’.

name: 32053 vert jaune clair
description: The pale green. Gentle, smooth and balanced. The third tone with the mural value of ‘Scenery’.

name: 32060 ocre
description: The natural sand. Restrained and very elegant. The first tone with mural value of ‘Sand’.

name: 32080 orange
description: The shiny orange. A dynamic, youthful and optimistic colour.

name: 32081 orange clair
description: The orange apricot. A dynamic, touching and consistently attractive ton.

name: 32082 orange pâle
description: The sandy orange. Earthy, gentle and constructive. The second mural ‘Sand’ colour.

name: 32090 rouge vermillon 31
description: The deep dynamic red. Or the luminescent vermilion red.

name: 32091 rose pâle
description: The gentle pink. Earthy, warm and restrained. The first shade with ‘Masonry’ significance.

name: 32100 rouge carmin
description: The noble carmine red. Steeped in history, dignified and brilliant.

name: 32101 rouge rubia
description: The artistic red. The tradition-rich red of famous painters.

name: 32102 rose clair
description: The bright pink. Or the medium dynamic rose.

name: 32110 l'ocre rouge
description: The red of ancient architecture. An earthy and deeply luminescent nuance.

name: 32111 l'ocre rouge moyen
description: The medium Terracotta. An earthy and warm tone, which emphasises comfort.

name: 32112 l'ocre rouge clair
description: The bright red ochre. Earthy and stable. The second shade with ‘Masonry’ significance.

name: 32120 terre sienne brûlée 31
description: The deeply burnt sienna. It fixes the wall impressively.

name: 32121 terre sienne brique
description: The light brick red. Suited for timeless colour combinations.

name: 32122 terre sienne claire 31
description: The colour of the summery masonry. Loamy and soft. The third ‘Masonry’ shade.

name: 32123 terre sienne pâle
description: The pale sienna. A sandy, discreet and stable colour shade.

name: 32130 terre d'ombre brûlée 31
description: The marron. Deeply red brown, burnt. Like a chestnut.

name: 32131 ombre brûlée claire
description: The burnt umber. An ideal background colour. The third shade with mural value of ‘Sand’.

name: 32140 ombre naturelle 31
description: The dark natural umber. An elegant brown grey colour.

name: 32141 ombre naturelle moyenne
description: The grey brown natural umber. A balanced, aesthetic and appealing colour.

name: 32142 ombre naturelle claire
description: The discrete natural umber. As shadow colour, ideal for combinations.

name: 4320A rouge vermillon 59
description: The cinnabar red. A fiery shade which catches the eye and reduces the space.

name: 4320B blanc ivoire
description: The ivory white. Elegant, charming, chalky. The calm background colour.

name: 4320C rose vif
description: The luminous pink. Less earthy and mostly used as complement to other luscious colours.

name: 4320D terre sienne brûlée 59
description: The deep brown sienna. A burnt, rich, dynamic and stable colour tone.

name: 4320E noir d'ivoire
description: The ivory black. Black as the night. Le Corbusier’s only, impressive black tone.

name: 4320F vert olive vif
description: The olive green. Green yellow or yellow green? A unique classic.

name: 4320G vert 59
description: The emerald green. A dynamic shade with luminous power.

name: 4320H gris 59
description: The dynamic medium grey. It reacts stable and dynamic in any light.

name: 4320J terre d'ombre brûlée 59
description: The dark burnt umber. Resembles mahogany. It can camouflage and hide.

name: 4320K bleu outremer 59
description: The spectacular ultramarine. An impressive colour shade which moves worlds.

name: 4320L ocre jaune clair
description: The golden ochre. A deep, powerful and very present colour tone.

name: 4320M le rubis
description: The ruby. It is darksome and shining, velvety, festive and luxurious.

name: 4320N bleu céruléen 59
description: Represents sky and sea. The colour shade is virtually infinitely combinable.

name: 4320O gris clair 59
description: The grey in the morning. Somewhat cool. The shade is receding in contrast to white.

name: 4320P terre sienne claire 59
description: The natural sienna ochre. Earthy, warm and softer than yellow.

name: 4320R ombre naturelle 59
description: The deeply dark natural umber. Camouflaging, emphasising other colours.

name: 4320S orange vif
description: The powerful orange. Saturated and energetic. It steps forward and unfolds bold effects.

name: 4320T bleu outremer foncé
description: The profound ultramarine blue. A fascinating shade which reflects infinity.

name: 4320U gris foncé 59
description: The dark grey. Strong, rich and close to a metallic effect.

name: 4320W le jaune vif
description: The yellow colour of the sun. It shines impressively in good light.
